tiled.core

Class Map

  • java.lang.Object
    • tiled.core.Map
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<MapLayer>

    public class Map
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<MapLayer>
    The Map class is the focal point of the tiled.core package.

      • removeLayer

        public MapLayer removeLayer(int index)
        Removes the layer at the specified index. Layers above this layer will move down to fill the gap.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the layer to be removed
        Returns:
        the layer that was removed from the list

      • removeAllLayers

        public void removeAllLayers()
        Removes all layers from the plane.

      • getLayers

        Returns the layer vector.
        Returns:
        Vector the layer vector

      • setLayers

        public void setLayers(java.util.Vector<MapLayer> layers)
        Sets the layer vector to the given java.util.Vector.
        Parameters:
        layers - the new set of layers

      • getLayer

        public MapLayer getLayer(int i)
        Returns the layer at the specified vector index.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the layer to return
        Returns:
        the layer at the specified index, or null if the index is out of bounds

      • resize

        public void resize(int width,
          int height,
          int dx,
          int dy)
        Resizes this plane. The (dx, dy) pair determines where the original plane should be positioned on the new area. Only layers that exactly match the bounds of the map are resized, any other layers are moved by the given shift.
        Parameters:
        width - The new width of the map.
        height - The new height of the map.
        dx - The shift in x direction in tiles.
        dy - The shift in y direction in tiles.
        See Also:
        MapLayer.resize(int, int, int, int)

      • inBounds

        public boolean inBounds(int x,
               int y)
        Determines whether the point (x,y) falls within the plane.
        Parameters:
        x -
        y -
        Returns:
        true if the point is within the plane, false otherwise

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<MapLayer> iterator()
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<MapLayer>

      • addTileset

        public void addTileset(TileSet tileset)
        Adds a Tileset to this Map. If the set is already attached to this map, addTileset simply returns.
        Parameters:
        tileset - a tileset to add

      • removeTileset

        public void removeTileset(TileSet tileset)
        Removes a TileSet from the map, and removes any tiles in the set from the map layers.
        Parameters:
        tileset - TileSet to remove

      • contains

        public boolean contains(int x,
               int y)
        Returns wether the given tile coordinates fall within the map boundaries.
        Parameters:
        x - The tile-space x-coordinate
        y - The tile-space y-coordinate
        Returns:
        true if the point is within the map boundaries, false otherwise

      • getTileHeightMax

        public int getTileHeightMax()
        Returns the maximum tile height. This is the height of the highest tile in all tileSets or the tile height used by this map if it's smaller.
        Returns:
        int The maximum tile height

      • swapTileSets

        public void swapTileSets(int index0,
                int index1)
        Swaps the tile sets at the given indices.

      • getOrientation

        public int getOrientation()
        Returns the orientation of this map. Orientation will be one of ORIENTATION_ISOMETRIC, ORIENTATION_ORTHOGONAL, ORIENTATION_HEXAGONAL and ORIENTATION_SHIFTED.
        Returns:
        The orientation from the enumerated set

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns string describing the map. The form is Map[width x height x layers][tileWidth x tileHeight], for example Map[64x64x2][24x24].
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        string describing map
